name: TVPlayer
desc: A customizable native media player used to control playback from the JavaScript player used in an Apple TV client-server app.

items.name: init(player: AVPlayer)
items.desc: Creates a new customizable player from an existing player.

items.name: var playlist: TVPlaylist?
items.desc: The playlist for the media player.

items.name: func next()
items.desc: Plays the next media item in the playlist.

items.name: func previous()
items.desc: Plays the previous media item in the playlist.

items.name: var state: TVPlaybackState
items.desc: The current state of the player.

items.name: enum TVPlaybackState
items.desc: The possible states of a player.

items.name: func dispatch(event: TVPlaybackEvent, userInfo: TVPlaybackEventMarshaling?, completion: ((Bool) -> Void)?)
items.desc: Dispatches custom playback events to the JavaScript environment.

items.name: struct TVPlaybackEvent
items.desc: Extend this structure to send your custom playback events to the JavaScript environment.

items.name: protocol TVPlaybackEventMarshaling
items.desc: A protocol used for sending and receiving information across the JavaScript bridge.

items.name: class TVPlaybackCustomEventUserInfo
items.desc: The user information used in a custom playback event.

items.name: func setCurrentMediaItem(toItemAtIndex: Int)
items.desc: Sets the current media item to the designated media item.

items.name: var nextMediaItem: TVMediaItem?
items.desc: The next media item in the playlist.
